column4: I am on a fresh install of 9.04, and right off the bat, it told me my broadcom driver was enabled, but it doesn't work. What is wrong?
did you configure it with iwconfig or some graphical configurator?
did you install over the wireless?
I installed without being hooked to ethernet, but it should not have activated my wireless without accepting the restricted driver, should it?
does ifconfig show your wireless device?
there's your problem the driver isn't loaded
how do I fix it? I deactivated and reactivated it in the restricted drivers tool
Nah, figured best help was on here. I can look though
The only remedy I found was a complex series of steps that involved manually shutting off the wireless card by using the switch, but my laptop is a macbook... no switch
you installed jaunty on a macbook?
I tried removing the driver and rebooting, then enabling it again.. No go
is the driver loaded, what does ifconfig say, have you used iwconfig or System->Administration->Network  to set it up   ...you're a mac guy, you can figure it out
